channel.title: JDK not detected?
channel.description: I downloaded JDK 6.0 Update 1, installed it and compiled my server and it said "Java is not recongnized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file." I tried installing again and it wouldn't work so I just uninstalled it :( now all I have is Java (TM) 2 Platform Standard Edition Binary. Please help me!

item.title: JDK not detected?
item.dc:creator: @MoparRocksScape MoparRocksScape
item.description:
@MoparRocksScape wrote:

Inching Away:

Try this tutorial to get the runserver to work. http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,111589.0.html.

That has nothing to do with it lol

Read full topic

item.title: JDK not detected?
item.dc:creator: @MoparRocksScape MoparRocksScape
item.description:
@MoparRocksScape wrote:

Okay I will do that now.[br][size=1]Posted on: April 07, 2007, 05:54:22 PM[/size][hr][quote=“lothy, post:2, topic:76258”]In your compiler put this:

"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_01\bin\javac.exe" *.java

In your runserver.bat file put this:

"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_01\bin\java.exe" -cp server

That should do the trick provided you actually have the version you mentioned.[/quote]
Lol how do I do that…I downloaded SvenScap3pk v2

Read full topic

item.title: JDK not detected?
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“MoparRocksScape, post:4, topic:76258”][quote author=lothy link=topic=111978.msg1113532#msg1113532 date=1176007665]
In your compiler put this:

"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_01\bin\javac.exe" *.java

In your runserver.bat file put this:

"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_01\bin\java.exe" -cp server

That should do the trick provided you actually have the version you mentioned.
[/quote]
Okay seeing that I have to download and install JDK 6 Update 1 do I pick the off or online installation?[/quote]
Take your pick. I always take the offline version though so I actually have the installer on my computer for a later date.

Read full topic

In your compiler put this:

In your runserver.bat file put this:

That should do the trick provided you actually have the version you mentioned.
